meanings.definition: A sudden, impetuous movement or rush
meanings.sent1: The cat made a brashes towards the mouse.

meanings.sent3: The brashes of the wind blew my hat off.

meanings.sent5: The brashes of the waterfall echoed in the canyon.

meanings.definition: A small, thin branch or twig
meanings.sent1: She used a brashes to tickle her friend.
meanings.sent2: The bird built its nest with brashes and leaves.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the brashes were magic wands.

meanings.definition: To break or snap off with a sudden, sharp noise
meanings.sent1: He brashes the pencil in half when he was frustrated.
